item.title: Wiegman defiant as she responds to Earps criticism
item.description: Sarina Wiegman does not think she "would have done things differently" despite criticism from goalkeeper Mary Earps in her autobiography.

item.title: Famous Cardiff nights fuel Wales' World Cup dream
item.description: Wales hope to summon the magic of big nights at Cardiff City Stadium as they face North Macedonia in a pivotal World Cup qualifier.

item.title: 'Scotland must shake shackles of past to grasp World Cup dream'
item.description: Scotland must seize on Denmark's vulnerability to earn the win on Tuesday - live on the BBC - that will take them to their first World Cup since 1998.

item.title: Fears Arsenal's Gabriel could be out until January
item.description: Arsenal are set to discover the full extent of the thigh injury suffered by centre-back Gabriel while on international duty with Brazil.

item.title: What's going wrong for Chelsea in the WSL?
item.description: Back-to-back draws and three points behind leaders Manchester City, BBC Sport explores what's going wrong for Chelsea this season.

item.title: Norwich name ex-Rangers boss Clement as head coach
item.description: Norwich City appoint former Rangers manager Philippe Clement as head coach on a contract that runs until 2029.

item.title: Penguin in past as Pfannenstiel focuses on Pittodrie plans
item.description: New Aberdeen sporting director, Lutz Pfannenstiel outlines his vision, insisting his arrival is "good news" for manager Jimmy Thelin.

item.title: Which Premier League teams will lose most players to Afcon?
item.description: BBC Sport has a look at which Premier League clubs will be most - and least - affected by the Africa Cup of Nations.

item.title: Hemp returns to England squad but James misses out
item.description: Forward Lauren Hemp returns to the England squad for the first time since Euro 2025 after recovering from injury, but Lauren James misses out.

item.title: Fulham offer new deal to manager Silva
item.description: Fulham offer a new contract to manager Marco Silva, whose current deal expires at the end of the season.

item.title: Is Donley ready to fill Northern Ireland's 'problem position'?
item.description: After scoring his first senior international goal against Luxembourg on Monday, is Jamie Donley the right man to lead the line in Northern Ireland's World Cup play-off?

item.title: 'I make decisions to win' - Wiegman reacts to Earps comments
item.description: England manager Sarina Wiegman says she is only focused on creating an honest, open environment within her squad, insisting she makes decisions "to win".

item.title: Watch: Donley nets first Northern Ireland goal in win over Luxembourg
item.description: Watch the best of the action as Jamie Donley scores his first international goal for Northern Ireland in their 1-0 win over Luxembourg in World Cup qualifying.

item.title: Thompson's 'moment to remember' features in WSL best goals
item.description: Strikes from Chelsea's Alyssa Thompson, Liverpool's Beata Olsson and Manchester City's Lauren Hemp feature in the best goals from this weekend's Women's Super League.

item.title: I'd be disappointed if players feel pressure - Wales boss Bellamy
item.description: Craig Bellamy would be disappointed if his Wales team feel pressure before their final World Cup Group J qualifier against North Macedonia.

item.title: 'Not the image we want' - Tuchel on Bellingham reaction
item.description: England boss Thomas Tuchel gives his thoughts on Jude Bellingham's reaction to being substituted against Albania.

item.title: 'Quite cute' and 'in sync' - the father-son duo in non-league dugout
item.description: Father-son duo Craig and Scott Laird on the unique experience of co-managing together in the dugout at non-league side Street FC.

item.title: Triple injury scare for Arsenal defenders - how serious are they?
item.description: It has been an international break to forget for Premier League leaders Arsenal, with a triple injury scare threatening to impact their impressive defence.

item.title: Will Danish doubts & Hampden roar carry Scotland to World Cup?
item.description: Former strikers Billy Dodds and James McFadden assess Scotland's chances of defeating Denmark in Tuesday's World Cup qualification showdown at Hampden Park.

item.title: The tiny Caribbean island on verge of World Cup history
item.description: Players from the tiny Caribbean island of Curacao are 90 minutes away from qualifying for the World Cup for the first time, guided by Dick Advocaat.

item.title: Man City scout winger El Mala - Tuesday's gossip
item.description: Cologne winger Said El Mala is scouted by Manchester City, Nottingham Forest are unwilling to sell midfielder Elliot Anderson, Wolves midfielder Joao Gomes is open to joining Manchester United, plus more.

item.title: Was Gattuso right - is World Cup qualifying unfair on Europe?
item.description: Was Italy coach Genaro Gattuso making a fair point on places for Europe at the World Cup? Or was it just sour grapes?

item.title: Is Bellingham Tuchel's best player or problem to solve?
item.description: BBC Sport explores Jude Bellingham and Thomas Tuchel's latest dispute and what it means moving forward.

item.title: Germany and Dutch reach World Cup - who else can join them?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at who has qualified for next year's Fifa World Cup.

item.title: Northern Ireland enter play-offs 'with a lot of optimism'
item.description: Michael O'Neill says Northern Ireland enter March's World Cup play-offs with "a lot of optimism" after their 1-0 win over Luxembourg.

item.title: Exeter City working to get ground ready after fire
item.description: Exeter City are working to ensure Saturday's League One game with Burton Albion can be played following a fire at their St James Park ground.

item.title: Target Liverpool, go four at back - FPL tips to kick-start your season
item.description: What have we learned so far this FPL season? What's the best way to approach the game? Our four experts give you their best advice to get ahead of your rivals.

item.title: Man Utd striker Sesko out for about a month with knee injury
item.description: Manchester United striker Benjamin Sesko set to miss about a month with the knee injury he sustained at Tottenham Hotspur just before the international break.

item.title: Quiz: Which nations have qualified for 2026 World Cup?
item.description: For this week's big Tuesday quiz we want you to name every nation who has already qualified for the 2026 World Cup.

item.title: 'First time I cried in years,' says Irish hero Parrott
item.description: Republic of Ireland striker Troy Parrott tells BBC Sport's Sami Mokbel about his stellar goalscoring week and "tears of joy".

item.title: Tuchel to contact every overlooked England player
item.description: England manager Thomas Tuchel says he will video call or visit every player left out of his squad to explain his choices and what they need to do to make next summer's World Cup.

item.title: Why captain Wilson is much more than a super sub for Wales
item.description: Wales will not only turn to Harry Wilson to captain the side, but also look for a Gareth Bale style influence from the Fulham forward

item.title: Mbappe wants £230m from former club PSG
item.description: France captain Kylian Mbappe is seeking £231.5m from Paris St-Germain, with his former club demanding £211m, as their long-running dispute reaches the Paris courts.

item.title: US will give visa appointment priority to World Cup ticket holders
item.description: The Fifa Pass scheme will allow ticket holders to get faster appointments at US embassies

item.title: WSL referee 'lost role' after complaint to PGMOL
item.description: Women's Super League referee Lisa Benn tells an employment tribunal she lost her role as an international official after complaining about a referee coach "manhandling" her.

item.title: Bournemouth's Semenyo has £65m January release clause
item.description: Bournemouth winger Antoine Semenyo has a £65m release clause in his contract that can be activated during the first two weeks of the January transfer window.

item.title: O'Neill & Maloney continue interim Celtic tenure
item.description: Martin O'Neill and Shaun Maloney will continue to take charge of Celtic on an interim basis, until the process to appoint a new manager is complete.

item.title: Barcelona to play at Nou Camp after more than two years away
item.description: Barcelona will return to their iconic Nou Camp stadium after more than two years away when they face Athletic Club in La Liga this weekend.

item.title: Hamraoui 'forced out of PSG' after iron bar attack
item.description: Former Paris St-Germain midfielder Kheira Hamraoui files a £3m claim against the French club, alleging she was forced out after being attacked with an iron bar.

item.title: How will World Cup play-offs be determined?
item.description: Results this week will determine the play-off paths for Wales, Northern Ireland, the Republic of Ireland and, potentially, Scotland.

item.title: The key questions facing Tuchel before World Cup
item.description: England head coach Thomas Tuchel now faces key decisions in the countdown to the World Cup, says chief football writer Phil McNulty.

item.title: How hard is it for Channel Island players to become professionals?
item.description: Following Alex Scott's recent England call-up, BBC Sport examines how hard it is for Channel Island footballers to become professionals.

item.title: From Spurs fringes to Dutch delight - Parrott's rise to Irish hero
item.description: With five goals in two huge wins over Portugal and Hungary that have propelled Republic of Ireland into the World Cup play-offs, it has been a dream international window for Troy Parrott.

item.title: The Ratcliffe revolution - inside Man Utd's exodus and rebuild
item.description: BBC Sport tells the story of how Sir Jim Ratcliffe ripped apart and rebuilt Manchester United's leadership team.

item.title: Meet the man who played in two games, in two countries... in one day
item.description: BBC Sport tells the story of Soren Lerby, who once played for Denmark and Bayern Munich on the same day - in different countries.

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Why are England called the Three Lions?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain where the three lions on the England shirt came from.

item.title: When is the 2026 World Cup draw?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore when the World Cup draw is, how the seeding works and who has qualified so far.

item.title: Who is Wilfried Nancy?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team take a look who MLS manager Wilfried Nancy is.

item.title: Why VAR gets involved in some penalties but not others
item.description: It was a weekend of VAR penalty decisions in the Premier League, with spot-kicks awarded, cancelled and ignored. BBC Sport explains why.

item.title: Why can Channel Islands players play for England?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at why players born in the Channel Islands like Alex Scott can represent England at a senior level.

item.title: What are the Fifa Best Awards?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain what the Fifa Best Awards are, who can vote and who the nominees are.

item.title: Why do footballers tape up their wrists?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explains why footballers use tape to wrap their wrists.

item.title: 'Time for heroes, a free hit, get into them' - your Scotland messages
item.description: Put yourself in the shoes of the Scotland manager and pick the side and tactics and decide what your pre-match team talk would be.

item.title: How to follow Scotland's crucial World Cup qualifier on BBC
item.description: Scotland host Denmark on Tuesday, aiming to reach the World Cup for the first time since 1998, and you watch exclusively on the BBC.

item.title: Scotland 'good enough' to qualify, says Clarke
item.description: Head coach Steve Clarke insists Scotland are in a "good place" for the "cup final we all wanted" against Denmark on Tuesday, with a World Cup place on the line at Hampden.

item.title: How content creator became scout in Serie A
item.description: How former content creator Felix Johnston became a first-team scout for Serie A club Como 1907.

item.title: England to host Spain at Wembley for World Cup qualifier
item.description: Euro 2025 winners England will host world champions Spain at Wembley in April for a 2027 Women's World Cup qualifier.

item.title: Spurs show progress in draw against Arsenal
item.description: Level on points with Arsenal, five wins from nine and the most clean sheets in the Women's Super League this season - Tottenham are in a good place.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: How does Daniel Levy run Tottenham - and would he ever leave?
item.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
